body:
Thanks, I was on the verge of raising this myself. My thoughts about why this feature would be important and valuable:

- Splitting up MODULE.bazel into parts is vital for any non-trivial repo. And frankly, most commercial users of Bazel probably have very complex, extensive monorepos, often with interdependencies. If any are like us, they will use git_repositories heavily between internal modules rather than maintaining an internal registry. `include()` in MODULE.bazel is a must-have for these users, and being able to only leverage this in root workspaces makes the feature almost useless.

- The argument for disallowing `include()` more generally hinges on the published representation of Bazel modules, which is not a consideration for local, http_archive, or git_repository overrides.

- Given the suggestion to concatenate MODULE.bazel includes on publishing to a registry, this feature would be needed to make local development of published modules coherent with use of the published modules.

The current implementation tends to push everything to the lowest common denominator, which is to bundle everything into one unwieldy MODULE.bazel file, due to the present limitations.

issue.title: Permit `include()` in modules subject to non-registry overrides

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Such overrides already require an eager fetch of the entire module's sources, so there is no benefit to performance if `include()` is forbidden for these modules.

Fixes #27137

issue.title: chore: Down with WORKSPACE

repository.name: rules_py
repository.description: More compatible Bazel rules for running Python tools and building Python projects

issue.body:
This is a massive combined patch aimed at starting to address a whole pile of WORKSPACE related techdebt and migration pain points.

Major points:
- Delete the `WORKSPACE` file
- Delete `WORKSPACE` supporting private files
- Retain `WORKSPACE` supporting `py/repositories.bzl` for now; will drop in future 2.0 release
- Synchronize how we're configuring Rust and the crossbuild toolchain(s) with the Aspect CLI, other projects

As future items we can go through and consider bumping dependencies

### Changes are visible to end-users: no

### Test plan

- This is the test plan

### Remaining items
- [x] Eliminate dev proto dependencies
- [x] Drop source build Gazelle for prebuilt  
- [x] Get local tests to green
- [x] Inline out `include()` statements which block subrepo/e2e tests (cf. bazelbuild/bazel#27137)
- [x] Update the release generation flow to discard all the dev dependencies and retain only the desired prod MODULE.bazel content
- [x] Test the release artifact generation flow; ensure release artifact naming expectations are preserved

issue.title: [8.5.0] Permit `include()` in modules subject to non-registry overrides

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Such overrides already require an eager fetch of the entire module's sources, so there is no benefit to performance if `include()` is forbidden for these modules.

Fixes #27137

Closes #27144.
